_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Two people who arise in the world for th: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Two incredible human beings who arise in: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Two people whose death is regretted by m: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Two who are worthy of a monument [an2.63: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Two kinds of Buddhas [an2.63:2.2]: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Two who are not startled by a crack of t: A mendicant who has ended defilements
A thoroughbred elephant, horse, or lion
Two reasons fauns see not to use human s: Not to misrepresent others with falsehoods
Tale-bearing in a disciplinary issue (a: Tale-bearing on both sides is not settled internally
Tale-bearing on both sides is well settled internally
